intro: Mattiastrum karakoricum, commonly known as the Karakoram stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Karakoram Mountains. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, adapted to store water in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink, typically blooming in late summer. Mattiastrum karakoricum is well-suited to rocky and gravelly soils, thriving in full sun and cold climates.
